author: morningstar.com
title: Palo Alto Networks' Revenue Up
text:
Palo Alto Networks Inc. reported a sharply wider fourth-quarter loss as higher costs offset a 59% revenue increase.
A series of high-profile corporate security breaches have boosted interest in cybersecurity, boosting the price of the company's stock over the past 12 months to a high of $200.55 on July 24.
Billings, which include revenue and change in deferred revenue, surged 69% to $393.6 million in the latest period.
"We are significantly outgrowing the market and rapidly taking share," Chief Executive Mark McLaughlin said.
Shares, up 35% this year, rose 5% to $174 in late trading.
For the current quarter, the Santa Clara, Calif., company projects profit of 31 cents to 32 cents a share on $280 million to $284 million, up from 31 cents and $269.7 million a year earlier but short of analysts' average projection of 53 cents a share on $357.6 million in revenue, according to Thomson Reuters.
Palo Alto has reported losses in all but one fiscal year and ended the latest year with a loss of $165 million, compared with $226.5 million a year earlier.
Its accumulated deficit reached $500.7 million at the end of the quarter.
Over all, for the quarter ended July 31, Palo Alto Networks reported a loss of $46 million, or 55 cents a share, compared with a loss of $32.1 million, or 41 cents a share, a year earlier. Excluding stock-based compensation and other items, the company reported a profit of 28 cents, up from 11 cents a year ago.
Revenue rose to $283.9 million from $178.2 million a year earlier.
The company had projected profit of 24 cents to 25 cents a share on revenue of $252 million to $256 million.
Operating expenses surged 57% to $244.1 million.
Gross margin improved to 73.8% from 72.7% a year earlier.
Write to Maria Armental at maria.armental@wsj.com
 09, 2015 17:25 ET (21:25
